citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Leptolinea (Lep.to.li′ne.a. Gr. adj. leptus fine; L. fem. n. linea line; N.L. fem. n. Leptolinea fine, line-shaped organism).
Cells are non-motile, forming very fine multicellular filaments (0.2 μm wide or less).
The main fatty acids are branched C17 : 0, C16 : 0, C14 : 0 and C17 : 0.
The G+C content of genomic DNA is 48.2 mol%.
The phylogenetic position is in the family Anaerolineaceae.
The type species is Leptolinea tardivitalis.
